text: The first thing we SEE in this shot which should appear  seamless in its one continuous motion transition from the preceding scene, is a spider-web. We are TIGHT on the web which a still-living insect struggles against his silky b The web begins to tremble as from up above the spider dro spinning thread lowering itself down on this latest victi soon to be lunch. As the spider makes this journey we bec aware in the b.g. of the panting sounds of lovemaking. It a woman's breathless sighs and gasps we hear, but under t perhaps a man's voice, perhaps not. The sounds build to a climax as the camera continues to pull back until it disc the glistening body of a beautiful young Parisian woman i post-coital dewy Nirvana. Then, the figure of a nude man silhouette enters frame and crosses over to the shuttered window. His face and body are half-lit by the slats of li that penetrate from the world outside the hotel room. He  lights a cigarette.

whom we will come to know as CARLOS. He lights the cigare and takes a thirsty drag sucking the smoke deep into his  lungs, glancing out at the street and alternately at the  spider who tiptoes down to her prey. He watches the spide envelop the still-living victim with her spindly legs. Th he takes another drag on the cigarette and the ash glows  bright, a burning ember which he touches ever so slowly t the spider's body. It sizzles.
(whispering to the  burnt spider) You lose...
He looks out through the shutters at the digital clock ac the square. Then he glances back at the girl whom we will call COLETTE. The conversation is in French with English  subtitles.
What do you mean?
I mean get out.
You're a pig, you know that? How can  you be like that?
Carlos crosses to her slowly. He runs his hand across her cheek, then down across her throat. Death is in his eyes.
(barely above a whisper) Leave without saying another word.

Carlos stands in front of the mirror. The mirror is crack and in it we see the fractured face of Carlos staring bac at us from opposite sides of the cracked glass. He wears  surgical gloves. From a make up kit by the side of the si he removes a piece of false hair and spirit gum as TITLES CONTINUE. A. Carlos affixes a John Lennon mustache. B. Carlos puts on a brown wig of moderately longish hair  such as one might have seen on a student in Paris in the  early seventies. C. Carlos puts on a pair of John Lennon granny glasses an the student look is complete. D. Carlos stands in front of a full length mirror in jean and a blue work shirt over which he puts a worn grey jack He now looks every inch the young French student dressing down to look like one of the proletariat.

E. Carlos takes an M26 hand grenade and puts it into an i pocket of his coat. He puts a machine pistol and snaps it ammo clip into it and puts it in his student's shoulder b and then takes a Walther PPK and places it in his jeans a the small of his back. All the while that he is doing the things he sings: "ALL YOU NEED IS LOVE."
(singing) All you need is love...  Rum da, da da da  All you need is love  Rum da da da da  All you need is lo-ve  Love is all you need.  Love is all you need.
SUPERIMPOSED: Paris, September 15, 1974.

It's a hot Sunday afternoon and the complex of shops and cafe in St. Germain-des-Pres is bustling with young clien Inside the cafe, there is a second floor with a balustrad overlooking the tables inside. Outside, there are tables up on the sidewalk. JACK SHAW, a tall, husky American in his late thirties, s at one of the front tables outside. He reads the Internat Herald Tribune. The headline is, "Terrorists Seize Embass Issue Demands And Threaten Attacks." Jack sips his espres

dressed as in preceding scene. He enters. Just then Jack  looks up and sees him. For an instant, Carlos looks at Ja tenses just slightly. Jack looks back at his paper paying attention. Carlos pulls out a cigarette, pats his pockets for a light. Then he crosses to Jack.
Pardon monsieur...
He mimes flicking a match and Jack looks for a match. He' out. He offers the lit end of his cigarette. Carlos cups  Jack's hand.
Merci.

He crosses away from Jack, smiling and goes inside the ca Jack follows him absentmindedly, tracking his progress th the windows, though his view is obscured somewhat by  reflections of the street. Carlos steps casually to the  railing overlooking the tables inside as Jack sees the do image of Carlos and the reflected street scene. Carlos le over, pulls the pin from an M26 grenade, and lets the "sp come off in his hand. We HEAR the timing fuse hiss as Car nonchalantly counts to himself.
(counting) One thousand one... one thousand  two... one thousand three...

He looks up just in time to see Carlos drop the grenade  casually into the crowd below. Their eyes lock for a beat then Carlos smiles, turns and bounds away. Jack's eyes wi in horror. He gets up, about to cry out a warning.
the crowd below as the grenade EXPLODES, filling the air  with smoke and flying glass, its metal ripping through fl and bone. People are wounded, bloody and writhing in pain and screaming in panic.

disheveled, covered with the shattered glass of the windo but not but not seriously hurt, he struggles to his feet. looks around for Carlos who has vanished, now realizing w he was. As he looks around, he sees a SMALL BOY staring a his left arm with heart-rending disbelief. The boy has no hand.

There are throngs of ambulances, police and military  personnel, wounded survivors are being tended to. All is  confusion and off in a corner we SEE Jack, standing with man in a suit. The man's name is DU FOLTIERE. He shows Ja an I.D.
Du Foltiere, Monsieur, intelligence  liaison officer. DST. My understanding  is that you are the Deputy Chief of  Station, CIA, Paris, and that you  witnessed by coincidence this attack.
That's right.
And you have told my subordinate  that you recognized the terrorist as  Carlos?
Du Foltiere pulls out a small notebook to take notes.
That's not what I told him. I said  he recognized me. Afterwards I  realized who he was. By then it was  too late.
(writing in his  notebook) Ah yes... The deputy chief of station  did not recognize him... But he  recognized you.
I wasn't the one wearing the disguise.
Yes of course... But then how are  you sure it was him?
How often do you see someone holding  a live grenade listening to the fuse?  Besides, the arrogant son of a bitch  bastard smiled at me.

SUPERIMPOSED: Vienna, December 21, 1975 It's a cold Sunday morning with a light snow just beginni to fall when SIX YOUNG MEN and ONE WOMAN enter the  headquarters of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting  Countries -- a modern, seven-story block of concrete and  glass. They all carry Adidas sport bags over their should Their leader, Carlos, with dark beret and sunglasses, spo a long white raincoat -- the kind that was very much in  fashion that winter. Next to him is KOJ, a Japanese terro and his most trusted Lieutenant.
(singing) I shot the sheriff...  But I did not shoot the deputy...
At a long oval table TWELVE OIL MINISTERS. Miniature nati flags in chromium holders in front of them. Behind, sitti or standing, the SECRETARIES, ADVISERS, INTERPRETERS AND  BODYGUARDS.
...Obviously some of the members are  exploiting the oil price differentials  as a loophole... This body has been  very precise in its policy.

The group with the Adidas sport bags approaches the recep desk. Carlos -- moustache, sideburns, and wispy beard in  reddish brown -- smiles politely at the female RECEPTIONI Behind the reception desk are two circular staircases whi wind their way up to an elevator that is visible behind t railing at the top of the landing. There is what appears be a security man standing at that elevator with an earpi and tell-tale bulge under his jacket.
(in German) Pardon me. Is the conference still  in progress?
Smiling back, the ash-blonde receptionist nods.
(in German) Yes, but sir...
(in German) I have an urdent delivery for the  ministers.
As if on urgent business, Carlos quickly heads up the fli of stairs before the security man who stands next to the  receptionist can react. The security man speaks quickly i his walkie talkie.

by the elevator at the top of the stairs. Carlos bounds u the stairs and pushes the elevator button. The Security M near the elevator listens intently to what is being said his earpiece and he steps forward to challenge Carlos. Ca smiles at him and whips out a 9mm. silenced Beretta and f two shots right between the Security Man's eyes. He falls over the railing and lands face up on the console in fron of the terrified receptionist. Carlos leans over the rail one move and fires two shots into the upturned face of th Security Man who stands next to the shocked receptionist. The receptionist screams.
(angry) I protest the unfound charges of the  oil minister from Venezuela. We do  not use, nor intend to use, the lower  gradings to capture more of the market --
His words are cut short when the door is kicked open, and Carlos strides in.
(brandishing his  automatic) EVERYONE FREEZE!

Everyone frantically hits the floor. That is, with the  exception of TWO BODYGUARDS. They try for their weapons. short burst from Carlos' Beretta machine pistol which is  pulled from the inside of his trenchcoat brings them to t floor. This weapon is not silenced, but deafening. Just t Koj enters the room from the corridor.
We've got company.
Suddenly, there's the sound of INTENSE GUNFIRE coming fro the corridor.

He reaches into his trenchcoat and pulls out a pocket-siz Chinese RGD5 grenade. He yanks the pin, lets the spoon fl listens to the fuse hiss, counts quite calmly and then to the live grenade to Koj who catches it and in one movemen tosses it out the door. A loud sound of GRENADE EXPLOSION and plaster powders those glued to the floor. GASPS OF TE But the gunfire outside ceases.
My name is Carlos. You'll do as I  say.
His smile is cunning, mocking, and... familiar.
We SEE an Air France jet liner touch down on the runway.
Jack comes down the steps of the just-landed jet. The bli whips around his face as he walks down the stair unit and onto the tarmac, pulling his overcoat up around him.

Behind the desk is CARL MICKENS, the CIA Station Chief -- tall, angular, cropped grey hair. He is in mid-conversati with Jack Shaw who sits opposite him, his overcoat over t arm of the chair in which he sits. He has obviously just  come from the airport.
...Twenty million dollars ransom.
Who's asking for it?
"The Arm of the Arab Revolution."  Alias of the month time. (shrugs) Could be anybody. The point is...  their leader claims to be Carlos...
He does, does he?
He wants to make sure everyone knows  it's him. He wants the credit and  the Austrians want a positive ID.  That's when your name came up.
Who brought my name up?
The guy who says he's Carlos. The  Austrians want you there to identify  him.
Where?
At the airport. Tomorrow. When they  provide the plane to fly him and the  hostages to Libya. Carlos evidently  feels very comfortable in Libya.
They got him here in their own  backyard and they're gonna let him  walk away?!
They've got no choice, Jack.
Bullshit! Let 'em handle it like the  Israelis would.
They're not the Israelis Jack. It's  not their fight.
Then let me take him out! They want  me to meet him at the airport. I can  get close enough to get a clear shot  at him. We can end this shit now.
Jack! He's got seventy hostages.
Fuck the hostages!
Mickens looks at him almost in horror. Jack knows he has down too much of the mask of professionalism as it were.
(apologetically) Harold, we can handle it with a  minimum loss of life.

We will handle it with no loss of  life. Those aren't just any hostages.  They are the oil ministers of the  richest countries in the world, and  that twenty million bucks they're  gonna have to pay isn't gonna break  'em you know. It's nothing to them.  They just want to pay it and... it's  not our fight.
What do you think Carlos is gonna do  with that money? Put it in mutual  funds? He'll use it to hit us. Let  me assemble a team and we can...

Jack goddamnit, there isn't any team  to assemble! You're a fuckin'  dinosaur. We're out of the  assassination business. All of us!  You got a personal hard on against  this guy because he made you look  like an asshole and now he's gonna  rub your nose in it. I can appreciate  your feelings, but it's not going  down on our soil. It is not with our  nationals and it is not our fight!  Now I got my orders and you just got  yours.
Carl, Jack and various other CIA functionaries walk quick down the corridor with Austrian police and intelligence  officers. Jack carries a briefcase as do they all.
I gotta hit the john.

Jack stands inside of a stall in the men's room. He has j crossed a certain frontier in his mind and stepped in to area known as no man's land. He quickly takes off his ove and jacket and we SEE attached to his arm a harness made of straps and springs. He opens his briefcase and attache to the harness a .32 caliber Beretta. He fumbles with the adjustments, racing against time. Finally, he seems to ha adjusted everything just so. Then he lowers his arm to hi side. Then he raises the right arm as if shaking hands an the harness slams the .32 caliber Beretta from his forear straight into his palm. He resets the gun back into the forearm position. He has look of grim determination on his face. The only question is, is it the look of someone who is crazy enough to do w he is contemplating.

On the tarmac, an Austrian Airways DC9. TV cameras, light generators are set up in front of the plane, sending beam and pools of yellow light into the darkness and the snow  which swirls all around as a pool of REPORTERS stands rea to record whatever is about to go down. Among a small gro of OFFICIALS is Jack Shaw. Everyone's eyes are on an  approaching yellow curtained bus.
As it gets closer, we can detect through its windshield a white raincoat and a black beret. Carlos is standing by t driver with a machine-pistol in one hand and a grenade in the other.
His eyes strain to get a better look at the terrorist, hi arm down at his side.

As the bus parks by the DC 9, Carlos jumps out and waves the media. Not the customary V-sign, but the wave of a  celebrity... The hostages then, under their captors' guns file compliantly out of the bus and onto the plane. A lin of exhausted, bleary-eyed middle-aged men in expensive su and in need of a shave. Carlos however, is as fresh, aler and energetic as the morning of the attack. And he's  definitely savoring the moment.
Tense, he tries to be inconspicuous as he leans towards  Mickens.
(whispering) I think it's him, but I can't be  sure. Not with those dark glasses  and the beard...

Everyone on board, he too climbs the mobile steps and  disappears into the plane. Suddenly, he reemerges and com down to where the officials and Jack stand. As Jack watch him intently, he faces the MINISTER OF THE INTERIOR. In t window of the plane we SEE Koj holding a grenade to the  pilot's head.
Minister of the Interior, I  presume...?
The distinguished-looking man, who looks a bit like Kurt  Waldheim, nods.
I'm sorry this had to happen in  Austria. We have no quarrel with  your government.

His eye catching Jack, he stops in mid-sentence. A devili smile crosses his lips as he turns towards him. He pulls cigarette out and crosses right over to Jack, up close an as they say, very personal. The snowflakes whirl  surrealistically around them as the two stand face to fac
Pardon monsieur...
He mimes flicking a match. He takes off his glasses and l at Jack and smiles.
We were never really properly  introduced Mister Shaw. My name is  Carlos.

With a cunning, mocking smile he extends his hand out to  shake Jack's. Jack stares at him, ever so slowly beginnin to raise his hand. With that move he knows the gun will c slapping into his palm and he will be able to take Carlos out no matter what the cost.
(smiling) Eat shit and die slow.
His hand starts rising. In another second the gun will sp into it. Just then we hear:
Jack, no!
Jack turns to look at Mickens. Mickens indicates the  photographers.
You don't want your picture taken  shaking his hand.

Jack is momentarily confused. He has turned to Mickens  thinking perhaps he was calling out a warning and now the moment for the shot has passed. He turns back to Carlos w shrugs and steps over to the Austrian minister so that th Minister now is between Jack and Carlos and the shot is l
(to the minister) As I was saying, I'm sorry about the  loss of life. And thank you for your  cooperation.
Once again he sticks out his hand. Only this time, as the cameras roll, Austria's Minister of the Interior shakes t hand of the archterrorist in what will go down in history the "handshake of shame."
His eyes tell it all.
We begin with an ESTABLISHING SHOT of Al Aksa Mosque and Mosque of Omar in Jerusalem. These are the two most famou landmarks in Jerusalem's Old City skyline.

CAMERA then pans and tilts down and we are above the West Wall looking down on the bobbing black hats of Hassidic J the knitted skullcaps of more modern Orthodox, here and t the olive shirt of Army uniform with M16 or Galil assault rifle that sways in prayer as well.

To the Jerusalem stone paving stones that make up the squ in front of the wall as we glide across the intersecting  lines of paving stones set one next to the other until a  glowing cigarette comes into view and then a foot which  crushes it out. There should be something in this sequenc that is reminiscent of our opening, a foreboding that jus as the cracks in the Parisian paving stones led us to Car once before, perhaps these new stones will lead us once a to some act of terror.
to reveal a man standing in silhouette, the man who has j crushed out the cigarette. We cannot see his face because has a camera to his eye.
Through the lens of the camera just established we SEE an old Rabbi praying at the wall. CLICK! The shutter capture the shot.

The man in silhouette now lowers the camera and we SEE th he is CARLOS! There is no mistake even though the nose,  perhaps is a little different and this time he is clean- shaven, it is still Carlos the Jackals. He smiles slightl
Busy photographing it, Carlos doesn't seem to notice the ARABS who watch him surreptitiously. He walks in front of soldiers who laugh and look at us POV Carlos.

Carlos reaches into his pocket. Is he perhaps going for a grenade to toss at these soldiers? We build tension as he pulls out instead, another roll of film and with great  determination, we have the CLICK of the door of the camer to enhance our music beat as tension builds. Surely it ca be long till Carlos does something awful.
Carlos walks towards the Suq, working his way through the crown from the Damascus gate as we reveal more soldiers i the foreground, surveilling the area.

From the POV of the two Arabs following him, we SEE Carlo lost, or pretending to be, as he ambles along through the Suq, past all sorts of vendors hawking their wares. Heads fish are cut off with the swift slash of a knife in one s freshly skinned lambs hang by their feet in another. Carl still looking lost, approaches a street vendor hawking ro beads. We SEE them talk but cannot hear their dialogue. Carlos walks on.
A group of children play an impromptu game of soccer.
We watch these innocent children playing. If this was a g sight they'd be dead. CLICK!
It is Carlos who has taken the picture. His smile at the  sight of the children is no longer a subtle one. There is some secret enjoyment here. It's then, that he notices the Two Arabs tailing him.

He frowns. Now what happens can be interpreted in one of two ways. C takes a turn down an alleyway that has at first a shop or two, and then is nothing but deserted and foreboding alle He is either trying to shake the two Arabs or he has just entered every tourist's nightmare: a deserted alley in a  foreign country with two bad guys. He quickens his pace. Arabs do too. Carlos now knows they're after him and he t off running.
So do the two Arabs. Only now there are THREE MORE ARABS  coming after him.

A tense, desperate CHASE in the Moslem Quarter's labyrint of twisted alleys and narrow streets. When his Arab pursu lose sight of him briefly, Carlos takes something out of pocket, some sort of ID and throws it in an alleyway.

Carlos races through the Suq, past a group of Arabs who b heeding the call to prayer. They roll out prayer mats and begin acclaiming in Arabic that there is only one God and Mohammed is his prophet. Carlos grabs one of the canvas  awnings that shade the alleyways and this cafe. He rips i off, trying to make an obstacle course between him and hi pursuers. He overturns trays of olives, sacks of sunflowe seeds, anything he can get his hands on.

Carlos runs headlong into a copper serving platter that i hanging on display. He is disoriented, terrified, and the seemingly from out of nowhere, he is tackled, grabbed by Arabs and dragged to a dark alley between two stores. Car is overcome and brought down to the ground. One of the Ar evidently has a deep dislike for Carlos and though Carlos subdued, he kicks the shit out of him.

This room is your worst nightmare in the Middle East. It  could be a cellar suite in Beirut, or an interrogation ce in Damascus. There is no way of knowing. It is simply an  empty room with a large metal ring embedded into the floo to which Carlos is shackled. Battered and badly bruised,  he's obviously in great pain. The room's metal door SCREE as it opens slowly and a new man whom we will call AMOS  enters. With him are two of the Arabs we've seen earlier. They're bareheaded now, without their kaffiyehs.
(accented English) How do you feel?
He smiles.
(broken English) I do not speak English. (in Spanish) Yo soy Cubano... de Cuba... Castro...  Su amigos... Amigos... Entiende?
You spoke English well enough to  your contact... the street vendor...  so please let's not play games. We're  both professionals, Carlos.
(with heavy Cuban  accent) My name... Ramirez... no Carlos.
Yes, I know what your name is...  Illich Ramirez...
No Illich.
Alias Carlos Sanchez, alias Carlos  Martinez, alias The Jackal.
(with heavy Cuban  accent) Jou're loco man... No Carlos... I am  tourist...
Amos swoops down and with one hand pulls Carlos by the ha over across his knee with his throat up and other hand in hammer lock. Amos brings his face down to Carlos.
Listen to me you piece of shit. I'm  trying very hard to be professional  about this but you are in Israeli  hands now... So don't play games  with me... entiende hombre?
Carlos whose neck is stretched back like a goose about to slaughtered can barely croak out an answer.
Okay.
Amos loosens his grasp and straightens up. Carlos winces pain from broken ribs. As he speaks it is now unaccented  English, just the slightest trace of Spanish background.
You... You're telling me you're  Israelis... not Arabs? (relieved) I'm in some kind of an Israeli  prison... is that what you're telling  me?
Amazing how much your English has  improved in just a few seconds...

(trying to be very  reasonable) Look, obviously there has been some  kind of mistake. I don't know who  you think I am, but I am a Lieutenant  Commander in the United States Navy,  okay? I am Lieutenant Commander  Annibal Ramirez of the U.S.S.  Yorktown, Sixth Fleet, docked in  Haifa. I am not Carlos or Sanchez or  Illich or the Jackal or whoever you  think you just caught. If you call  the U.S. Embassy and ask for the  Sixth Fleet Liaison Officer, he'll  confirm everything I've said.
He is not pushy, just firm and decisive.
Remarkable... remarkable  performance... the chutzpa of it is  unbelievable... my hat is off to you  Carlos.

Carlos, who from now on out will be referred to by his re name, RAMIREZ, has had it with the reasoned approach. He adopts the demeanor of a U.S. Naval Officer reaming an  enlisted man a brand new bunghole.

Your hat's off?! I'll tear your head  off! You get on the horn and you  call the U.S. Embassy and you call  the Sixth Fleet Liaison Office and  then motherfucker you go out and  find yourself a good lawyer and I'll  tell you somethin' Jack, I'm gonna  sue your ass so bad that your great  great grandchildren will still be  shovelin' shit to pay off the debt!
Amos is doing his best to look unflappable.
Carlos... give me a break, huh? If  you were an American officer you  would have... ID papers, dog tags.
I ditched 'em in an alley just before  you guys got me. Go back there you'll  find 'em.
You ditched them.

Per instructions... An American  officer on shore leave in the Middle  East must travel in mufti, civilian  clothes. A bunch of Arabs start  chasing me... could be terrorism...  could be kidnapping... instructions  are to ditch our tags, our ID or  anything else that could identify  us. That's why I spoke Spanish, that's  why I said I was a Cuban, not an  American. And you broke my ribs here  asshole. I'm gonna sue you, I'm gonna  sue your government... I'm gonna sue  every fuckin' Jew I can get my hands  on you, understand me?!
Amos walks down the corridor. For the first time, he look the tiniest bit concerned.
(shouting after him) I'm gonna sue Menachem Begin, I'm  gonna sue Moshe Dayan, I'm gonna sue  the goddamned B'nai B'rith or whatever  you call it.
Amos sits in his office looking very worried. A long-hair baby-faced agent comes in. He could pass for a typical st traveling on holiday. His name is YONI.
Sir?

Yoni... I want you to go back to the  old city... where we caught...  Carlos... I want you to be very  inconspicuous. Take a half dozen  men... you comb every alleyway  there... every garbage can...  everything you can find... for what  looks like a U.S. military ID if  there is such a thing there.
What's the problem?
Who said there was a problem? There's  no problem. I just asked you to do  something and you're going to do it.  So there's no problem.

Yoni and half a dozen plainclothed Shin Bet agents walk  through the alley looking around. Yoni is dressed like a  long-haired backpacking student; others dressed like Arab others like tourists. As inconspicuously as possible, the search alleys and trash cans like the homeless searching food.
Amos sits at his desk. Just then Yoni walks in. Amos look up.
Nu?
Yoni puts a U.S. Navy ID complete with photo and a set of military dog tags on Amos' desk.
It identifies its bearer as Lt. Commander Annibal Ramirez U.S.N. There is a picture of Ramirez in the upper corner the ID in uniform.
He holds the ID and then sits back in his chair defeated lets out a very Jewish sigh.
Oyyyy.

This is a high-tech, ultra modern chrome and glass room w features a map of the world etched in plexiglass with  terrorist hot-spots marked prominently. On the glass as w is the logo of the CIA. In this Situation Room we find WI SCOTT III, a 50-year-old pin-striped suiter who appears t be amused. With him is Monroe, his Black deputy and Jack. front of Jack, spread out on the desk is a file on Ramire We SEE it as Jack does. Notes on the interrogation, Polar photos of Ramirez in custory and the developed pictures f the roll of film which Ramirez was taking in Jerusalem. J listens to Scott and Monroe, but as he does he is taking all the information in Ramirez's file, making no judgment just taking in information.
I love it! Those cocky Israeli  bastards thought they hit the jackpot.  Got the Jackal right in their own  backyard...
State Department's goin' apeshit.  And the Navy... Admiral Trost was so  pissed he was ready to shell the  port of Haifa.
Jack, however, isn't sniggering. He's thinking hard as he looks at all the information on the desk.
You're not gettin' it are ya?
What?

These weren't some yokels... This  was the Israeli General Security  Service... The Mossad. The best in  the business. They have the most  complete dossier there is on Carlos,  the latest pictures of him...  everything. I mean what's that tell  you?
That they really ate it this time.
Scott... doesn't it hurt to walk  around like that with your head up  your ass... I mean isn't it painful?
His eyes glance down to the pictures, especially the phot of the children. Something begins to click.
Almost nothing is as cute as 3 foot 5 inch 6-year-olds  struggling to play the most elementary form of baseball, ball.
He is the first baseman and he is intent upon the batter stands at the T.
cheering their kids on. Amongst them we recognize MAURA,  Annibal Ramirez's wife, who is cheering for her son's tea She holds a ten month old baby as she cheers.

on Annibal Ramirez, resplendent in his summer whites, his face still showing the faintest remnants of bruises at th hands of the Israelis. He holds his sea bag in his hand.  There is a waiting taxi behind him as he strides over tow the baseball diamond.
He sees his father just as the batter hits the ball.
Poppi!

The pitcher scoops the grounder up and tosses it to Joey  whose eyes however have lit up at the sight of his sailor father home from the sea so the ball hits him in the side the head and he goes down. Ramirez wants to rush out to h son, but Joey straightens himself up quickly, not wanting be embarrassed by an over-protective parent.
Maura has followed her son's gaze at Ramirez and feels no embarrassment whatsoever as she runs into his arms, still holding her baby. She kisses him.
I thought you weren't coming back  till tomorrow...
I wanted to be here for his game.  Look how beautiful she is!
He picks up the baby and kisses her.
Just like her mother.
What happened to your eye?
Nothing. Just fell. It doesn't matter.  I'm home.

It's a stucco, single-level structure in a clean, middle  income neighborhood. Jack Shaw pulls up, crosses out of h car and knocks on the door. The door opens revealing Rami in a T-shirt and pair of sweats. Jack looks at his face, unmistakable face of Carlos.
Joey watch Yolanda... okay?
Jesus...
I beg your pardon?
Lieutenant Commander Ramirez my name  is Jack Shaw... I'm with the  government... I'd like to talk to  you about what happened in Israel.
the barbeque's coals which burst into flame as fluid and  then match are applied. OVER this we hear
I want to sue them, okay? I want to  sue the guy who broke my ribs. I  want to sue their government and  their Mossad... and I want to sue  Golda Meir!
They stand at the barbeque as Joey plays shooting hoops.  Ramirez holds Yolanda. Ramirez and Jack speak quietly.
Mrs. Meir is dead, Lieutenant  Commander.
Then you might want to have them dig  her up because I intend to sue her.
Jack chuckles.
Commander Ramirez when I said I was  from the government, perhaps I should  have been more specific. I'm from  the CIA.

Jack reaches down, opens his briefcase and pulls out a la photo album-like briefing book. He opens it up and hands to Ramirez. On the first page there is an 810 enlargement of a photo of Carlos entering a building. It is grainy bu it certainly looks exactly like Ramirez.
