In the far distance, we are vaguely aware of a huge truck barreling along, coming straight down the highway towards them.
Yes.

We had an agent... the best we ever  had in training. We were going to  infiltrate him into Beirut and then  use him to penetrate the PFLP. No  student ever scored higher than this  man... We set up his cover for six  months in Argentina. He was perfect.  And then we sent him to Beirut. He  got off the plane, went to his hotel,  went up to his room and had a nervous  breakdown.

Suddenly it seems, the truck is right on top of them, hea straight for them, like monster in a child's nightmare. I passes within inches and Ramirez has to fight to keep fro jumping as the truck roars past them. It is not a monster just a truck. Then again, it could have killed them just same.

We had to mount an operation to send  in a man posing as a doctor so we  could drug him and get him out on a  plane. Okay? Now you understand?  Nothing prepares you. I want you to  know that so when it hits you, you  don't panic, you feel the fear and  then get rid of it.
Jesus...

You splash some water on your face.  You take some deep breaths. You look  in the mirror and when you look in  that mirror, I don't want you to  find Annibal Ramirez. You find Carlos.  If you find Carlos, that's what  everyone else will find too. And if  you find Carlos and anything goes  wrong, he's the one who can get you  out of it. Because he's the best.
(after a beat) I got a wife I got to go back to  when this is over. I got kids I got  to go back to when this is over. I  want to go back as Annibal Ramirez...  not Carlos.

You will... you'll need a time of  decompression and it will be hard at  first, but you will. Because inside  you aren't Carlos... you aren't a  terrorist. But right now, in order  to save your life, you've got to be.  You've got to look in the mirror and  find Carlos. Do you understand?
It is almost said like the offering of a vow.
I do.

You won't be able to go in with a  gun... too risky... so we're going  to have to get one to you once you're  in place. How I don't know yet...  But we'll get one to you. You'll  make your way out by boat. We'll be  on it. But we won't be able to help  if anything goes wrong. We'll make  our way down the coast to a friendly  state and then fly back to London,  and from there back to the U.S.
As passengers come out of the plane we recognize Ramirez  amongst them.

A cold, dreary, oppressive airport. Grim-looking SOLDIERS and even more menacing SECURITY MEN in dark glasses. In t line of arriving PASSENGERS, at the passport control boot is a limping Colombian businessman. Scanning the place fr behind sunglasses, his heart is POUNDING, POUNDING, POUND This is it. This is real enemy territory now, and he know it.

The foreboding paranoia that everyone is staring at him.  Soldiers, security men, airport employees, other passenge They all seem to know his secret. They're all just waitin for the axe to fall. Ramirez heads over to the Customs bo He turns back as a guard pushes him aside to let pass a r Arabic family. A young fat girl holding some toys grimace at him as she indelicately makes her way with her family  through the crowd. In the b.g. we notice a Mercedes waiti for them through the glass doors of the airport. Ramirez  continues on his way towards the Customs booth. Behind a  curtain, he sees a man being searched.
El Pass'port!
The sudden harsh voice jolts us all.
Pockmarked face with exaggerated features. Ugly and mean. Ramirez hands him his Colombian passport. The POUNDING  quickens.
Sheil el Nadara!

He barks in Arabic, motioning Ramirez to remove his  sunglasses. Ramirez does, fighting to remain calm under t man's granite gaze. The official looks at the passport an back at Ramirez. The following dialogue is in Arabic with English subtitles. Now and for every other scene in which Ramirez passes him off as Carlos, he has brown eyes.
Ricardo Moran Vargas?
Yes.
Tiny beads of sweat begin to form on his forehead.
Your business?
Pipes. I sell pipes.
Pipes?
Ramirez nods, smiling apologetically, searching for the w in Arabic. Ramirez struggles to appear calm. His heart's  POUNDING, however, intensifies.
For the oil...
Oil?
Pipes for oil... Petroleum...
(after a beat) Step over behind the curtain.
Ramirez's luggage is being thoroughly searched by the  Official. Finally the Official looks up at him.
All right. You can go.
Finally he stamps the passport.

We have a shot of the cab, an old Mercedes coming towards us, and then under the arch leading to the entrance of th hotel. Ramirez steps out and he's assailed by a bunch of  kids begging and trying to grab his baggage. He looks aro

Across the street at a cafe soldiers with guns laugh. Fro shop window, the silhouette of a man seems to look right us. Across the street, kids on a balcony throw a water ba at a horse pulling a cart and the horse bolts right in fr of Ramirez.

As the street urchins continue to beg and grab at his lug and the taxi driver demands impatiently to be paid, sudde out of nowhere, a bellboy appears and smacks one of the k who falls to the ground. They all disperse as the bellboy takes the luggage and leads Ramirez who pays the cab driv and then crosses to the hotel.

The bellboy enters with Ramirez, sets down his bags and t opens the shutters of the window. Ramirez tips him silent Once the bellboy has left, Ramirez walks to the phone and checks it out. Then he crosses to the shutters. Perhaps h sees a shadow looking in his direction from the dark apar across the street. He closes the shutters. Just then, the a LOUD KNOCK on the door. He jumps and automatically goes for his gun. But he has no gun... and his heart begins to POUND again. The LOUD KNOCK repeats itself.
(in Spanish) Who's there?
An incomprehensible response in Arabic.
(in accented English) What do you want?
Room service.
(after a pause) I not order nothing.
Iced water.
Iced water?
Yes, sir.
The voice is young, and not too assertive. Ramirez consul his watch and looks out the window again. Everything stil seems to be normal.
Sir...?

Ramirez carefully opens the door. In walks a young, rathe innocent-looking WAITER with a jar of ice water. He wears fez on his head. As he places it on a table, Ramirez eyes him with suspicion. Suddenly the waiter reaches underneat his jacket and... pulls out a small handgun.
He is frozen with fear.

Putting his finger to his mouth to signal silence, he sho the gun and silencer under a napkin. Then he takes off hi fez and from within, pulls out a small grenade and extra  clip of ammunition. Without any further attempt at  communication, he exits the room.
Jesus.
Ramirez walks back into the bathroom. He splashes water o his face and takes three deep breaths and then slowly loo up into the mirror... and finds Carlos.
We SEE a beautiful dark haired woman of about thirty comi down the street. There are several other pedestrians as w The woman is Agnieska. She carries a large bag of groceri

A van is parked on the street. Agnieska walks along. The starts. A man whom we will come to know as VLADIMIR adjus the mirror. His partner NIKOLAI readjusts it and in it we SEE Agnieska, walking. The two KGB operatives, now both s Agnieska.
[There she comes...]
[Do you see Misha?]
[Not yet.]
Behind Agnieska about fifty feet behind her we SEE severa pedestrians, one is an Arab and another a European. Agnie goes up into an apartment building.
[There he is.]

Around the corner comes another Arab businessman type. Th first Arab stops in front of the apartment house and bend down to tie his shoe. The second Arab comes up alongside him and the first Arab gives an almost imperceptible nod. The second Arab goes into the apartment house.
[He's passing her to Leonid. For  Russians, they make good Arabs.]
The van makes a U-turn and pulls around the corner to giv them another vantage point of Agnieska's apartment.
The two Russian operatives continue their stakeout of  Agnieska's apartment.

Agnieska enters the apartment. She opens the door and slo walks in. The apartment is dark. She is about to turn on lights when suddenly a hand grabs her from behind around mouth and another hand holding a gun snaps right down nex to her head. She drops the groceries and screams but the  hand muffles it. She struggles a bit but the person who h her hisses.
(in an Arabic accent) SHHHHHHH. One sound and you're dead.

Outside the door we hear faintly the sound of footsteps. still cannot make out who is holding her. He appears to b an Arab in traditional garb completely bald with mustache and glasses. He speaks in a thick Arabic accent.
Carlos... when is he coming here?
He loosens the grasp on her mouth.
I don't know what you're talking  about.
Don't play games with me. We've had  you followed. We know you're going  to meet him. Now, when?!
I don't know any Carlos... please  I'm telling you the truth.
The person holding her still has his gun at her head. He  cocks the trigger back with a loud noise. The gun has a  silencer on it.
This gun has a silencer. There won't  be any noise. Now talk!
I don't know what you're talking  about... I'm not from here. I just  came to visit a girlfriend. This is  her apartment. She'll be here  tomorrow... please.
The person who is holding her throws her to the floor. He stands over her.
You're lying...
I swear to you... I'm telling the  truth...
The bald Arab who was holding her slowly takes his belt o of its loops and puts his gun back in his pants. He holds the belt as if he is going to strangle her.
What... what are you going to do to  me.
First... I'm going to have some fun  with you... and then...
He reaches up to his glasses and takes them off and his  mustache and false nose...
Then I'm going to have something to  eat... I'm famished.

head_text.subj: WITH ANOTHER ACTOR SO THAT THE AUDIENCE HAS NO HINT THAT
THIS IS RAMIREZ. THEN ON THE CUT WHERE HE TAKES OFF HIS
GLASSES, IT SHOULD BE THE ACTOR PLAYING RAMIREZ, BUT HE I

text: You bastard! I haven't see you for  two years and this is the way you...
Ramirez laughs.
I had to be sure I could still trust  you.
He bends down to her and kisses her.

I came all the way to this god- forsaken country didn't I? I've been  holed up in this place you arranged  for me for the past twenty-four  hours... I couldn't eat I couldn't  sleep... nothing just sitting in  here waiting for you.
He picks her up in his arms and starts carrying her to th bed.
So why did you leave. . .?

Whoever stocked this place with food  didn't leave much of a selection...  I wanted to go out and get some nice  things for you. You weren't supposed  to be here for another three hours.  I could have made a nice dinner.
I've got what I want to eat in my  arms right now.
He lays her down on the bed and pulls up her skirt and hi head goes down out of screen as Agnieska arches her back sighs.
The silhouette of a fishing boat drifts along the coastli
We see the silhouettes of two men against the out of focu backdrop of the city. They are Jack and Amos, chain smoki Both men dressed as fishermen. Jack checks his watch.
I wonder what he's doing now.
Practicing safe sex, I hope.
Ramirez is in bed with Agnieska. She lays back smoking a  cigarette, sighing.
My God... my God...
Yeah... Now, let's eat.
He gets up and throws on his pants and crosses into the l kitchen. Agnieska follows, draping a blanket around her. crosses to a window and opens it.
What are you doing?
Just getting some air in here...  Don't be so jumpy.
He turns back to the refrigerator and opens it. Agnieska  crosses to the fallen sacks of groceries.
Forget about what's in there... I  found caviar and, here's some pate.
Didn't like the food I'd left for  you, huh?
His eyes scan the refrigerator.
Couldn't eat a bite of it.
His eyes still scan. He pulls a cucumber out of the  refrigerator and takes a bite and makes a face.
Ughhh... I don't blame you.
He opens the lid on the garbage can and throws the cucumb inside.
At the bottom are cigarette butts. CAMERA ZOOMS IN ON ONE IT IS FILTER-TIPPED. Ramirez turns around to her and comes up behind her.
Who was here smoking a filter-tip  cigarette my darling?
What?
You don't smoke filters.
What are you talking about?
He grabs her by the back of the neck and shoves her face  down into the garbage can.
That's what I'm talking about! The  filter-tipped cigarette. Who was  here.
You're crazy... no one... I...  Illich... listen... I ran out of  cigarettes and... and I was at a  cafe and I bummed a cigarette... I  had a cigarette and coffee and came  back here... that's all.
(loosening his grasp  just a little) You bummed a cigarette... that's  all.
Yes... yes... you know I can't have  coffee without a cigarette.
I believe you.
He straightens her up and rises with her. Then all of a s he grabs her by the throat and starts to strangle her.

The nearest cafe is two blocks away.  A cigarette wouldn't have lasted  that long... so you bummed a cigarette  but it wasn't in a cafe... it was  very close to here... In this  apartment building. Who did you meet  with? That window was a signal wasn't  it?! Wasn't it you puta bitch!
He starts to strangle her and we see not Ramirez but Carl
Tell me or you're dead!
He is choking the life out of her. She croaks out an answ
The French... the DST... They made  me... I didn't have any choice...
You sold me out!

He is choking the life out of her when we hear footsteps  racing down the hall. Ramirez throws Agnieska down, grabs his gun and grenade and races to the open window and goes out onto the fire escape. His feet are bare. He has no sh on.

Ramirez comes out of the apartment onto the fire escape.  Bullets hit the wall next to him and below we SEE several DST agents shooting up at him. A DST agent appears inside the apartment and shoots at Ramirez. Ramirez moves out of the way of the shattered window.
looking down and across the alley.
[Gunfire?! What the hell is going  on?!]
The two Russian operatives get out of their van.

DST agents from below are shooting up at Ramirez. Their  gunfire destroys everything in sight. Ramirez leaps over railing and flies across the street, landing on a terrace His momentum is so strong that he is propelled through th glass doors of the terrace.
Ramirez goes through the window of the apartment as bulle continue to fly. He cuts his feet on the broken glass.
Ramirez quickly goes through the apartment, falling into room, landing hard where a family is eating and watching We see now that Ramirez is wounded.

Ramirez comes out the door and starts toward the stairs.  Ramirez suddenly bangs into a DST agent. The two of them  look at each other in shock for a beat. Neither was expec the other to be there. The moment seems to last forever.  They are literally face to face. Which one will react fir Ramirez takes half a step back, raises his gun and fires, exploding the DST agent's forehead. Ramirez has a moment horror, splattered with the blood and brains of this man. Intercut a flash of the DST man being hit in an instant,  almost subliminal replay as if Ramirez's brain must regis the scene twice to comprehend it. Just then, a shot rings out from below and Ramirez, who can't help staring in hor at the dead man, flees once more for his life.
Two more DST agents follow the trail of blood up the stai

Ramirez arrives at the top of the stairs. Reaching the ed of the roof, Ramirez looks across to the other side. The agents arrive at the top and see Ramirez. Ramirez takes a deep breath and jumps, barely making it, clinging onto a  pipe on the side of the building. Once again, we Intercut the quick flashback of the DST man being shot. Then, as s ring out around him, Ramirez pulls himself up and gets aw

Ramirez checks over the side of the building to see a DST car following. One agent steps out and starts to shoot at him. Ramirez fires back and shatters the windshield and t jumps to the next rooftop.
Ramirez's silhouette runs from roof to roof.
Ramirez trips over a piece of metal and crashes through t metal roof of a shed, and then, landing, he takes off run through the narrow alley below.
Ramirez runs down the dark and narrow alley.

Outside a Turkish cafe, a DST agent shoots at Ramirez. Al the diners duck for cover. Ramirez shoots out the lights, the fixture sparks and flies off its hook, sending a stri of lights crashing down toward the DST agent, the bulbs  exploding around his head.
Ramirez arrives at a small street. In the distance we SEE the lights of a bright and busy street. Suddenly, headlig hit his face, gunfire rings out and Ramirez takes off fol by the oncoming car.

Ramirez is running from the car dodging bullets. Ramirez  lobs a grenade at the car. It explodes right in front of car, not taking it out, just damaging it. Ramirez runs ac the street and is hit suddenly by a motorcycle which then veers off and goes crashing into an oncoming car. Ramirez gets up and runs into a doorway.

Ramirez, sweating and out of breath, scans his new and da surroundings. While bleeding, Ramirez suddenly turns arou and shoots. A DST agent falls out of the darkness, dead.  Ramirez hears something. Turning around, Ramirez shoots a agent at the top of the building. The body falls and gets tangled into the string of electrical wires. He reaches i his pocket, pulls out another clip and re-loads.

Ramirez comes out of the doorway and waves down a taxi.  Ramirez jumps into the driver's seat, pushing the driver  aside. When the driver resists, Ramirez throws him out in the street. A passing truck nearly hits the driver. Other Arabs start approaching Ramirez but back off immediately once he rais his gun. The taxi makes a U-turn and leaves, racing throu traffic. Ramirez checks his mirror and sees that he is pi up by a DST car. They begin to shoot at Ramirez and his b window shatters.
Ramirez is driving full speed. The car jumps as it hits t junction of the street. Ramirez continues to be followed the car of DST agents. Ramirez turns into a small alley.
Ramirez drives down the narrow street. The sides of the c barely fit through. Sparks fly from the metal scratching  against the walls. The taxi's mirror pops off as the chas continues.

The cars continue to race through the streets. Ramirez  suddenly sees two kids coming out of a garage. Ramirez ve out of the way and misses the kids. The car goes crashing into scaffolding and paint drops down onto the windshield Once again, we Intercut the flashback of Ramirez killing first DST agent, being splattered with his blood. Ramirez continues to drive away, wiping away the paint on the  windshield.
Ramirez tries to wipe away the paint. The cars continue t race through the streets.

The two cars disappear down a hill. Ramirez's vision is  blurred by the paint on the windshield. A car suddenly ap that forces him to veer left into a stairwell. The taxi  descends the stairway. Ramirez suddenly pulls the parking brake and the other car hits Ramirez's car and flips over and explodes. Ramirez, watching the explosion, takes off other way.
On the harbor, a police car is seen next to Ramirez's tax The sergeant reveals some blood inside the taxi but Ramir is nowhere to be found. We SEE the KGB on the scene.

The fishing boat enters the harbor. Jack stands on the de as the boat passes under a bridge. Out of nowhere a man j onto Jack and shoves him to the ground. Holding him by th neck, Amos appears and is about to hit Ramirez but Ramire grabs Amos' arm and stares at him.
We SEE Carlos' villa through the barbed wire. The silhoue of a guard is on top of the building.
The real Carlos is asleep in the bed with a beautiful Ara woman. A Japanese KOJ enters and taps Carlos on the shoul Instantly he springs awake with a gun in his hand pointed KOJ.
Illich... you must get dressed. There  was a shooting tonight... We have to  talk.
What shooting... who?
Jack and Amos are with Ramirez who is furious. Amos is bi Ramirez's wounds.
What the fuck are you talking about,  you didn't know she was working with  the DST?
We didn't. How the fuck should we  know?
They're our allies, for Christ's  sake!
They didn't tell us this time. Why  should they it was their operation.  And we sure as shit weren't gonna  let them in on you being here.
Why not?! That way they wouldn't  have tried to kill me and I wouldn't  have wound up killing them.
It would have been too dangerous.
Too dangerous... what the fuck do  you think that was back there? Safe?  How the fuck more dangerous does it  have to get?

Annibal, the important thing was it  worked! The Russians have to think  it was Carlos now... . What did they  see? They trail the girl... and then  there's a shoot out. Let's make sure  they know it was DST... we can make  sure they get that information. If  they know the DST was there then  what were they doing there if it  wasn't to get Carlos. She betrayed  you, so tomorrow we take her name  off the bank account and we set up  another place for them to get their  pictures. We burned Libya but okay  so we'll find another place. The  only thing that matters is they've  got to believe it now. It's perfect!
You fuckin' maniac! I killed four  DST agents tonight! They're our allies  and they were tryin' to kill me and  I killed them. I killed our allies!
Hey fuck our allies!
Ramirez just looks at him in horror.

Annibal... policemen wind up shooting  other policemen... it happens. I  would rather have you here feeling  guilty about them than to know there  was a meeting in Paris tonight where  they were feeling guilty about you.
Annibal... you did what you had to  do and it worked. All the training  worked. Carlos couldn't have done it  any better.
He smiles.
The Head KGB Officer is there with his aide. Both look as they've been up all night.

[Whether Carlos was actually in there  with her or not we don't know... All  we know is there was a gun battle...  DST agents from what we've been able  to find out. But whether or not it  was Carlos...]
[If it was Carlos and he sent for  the girl... and she betrayed him...  Well... we should keep watch on the  girl. What he does about her will  tell us more than anything else.]
Carlos sits in the closed Villa with Koj and four other  terrorists.
So the moronic DST find an old  girlfriend and send her here to bait  a honey trap for me... and then they  trip over their own dicks and start  shooting each other... why?

There was a man with her... who we  don't know... They must have spotted  him come in... thought it was you  and moved too soon... before she  even made contact with you. Whoever  he was... he was awfully good.
Where is the girl now?
They've taken her to Paris.
I want the bitch dead!
It won't be easy.
If it was going to be easy I could  hire a couple of junkies. I want the  cunt dead! You handle it Koj. Hit  her in Paris, right under their  fucking noses and leave Europe through  London.
When?
Now! Leave now. Not this afternoon...  not five minutes from now... Now!
Koj gets up and leaves. Carlos turns to the others.
Something else troubles me my friends.  How was this woman going to make  contact with me. You're the only  ones who knew about this safe house.  So one of you was her contact.
They all start to protest too late as Carlos pulls out hi gun and shoots each of them.
Agnieska comes down the stairs, passes by camera.

A French DST security man comes out of the apartment buil first. He looks around the street and then nods. A second DST man comes out of the building and gets in a black Ren after first checking underneath it to make sure there is bomb and then popping the hood and examining the engine a then examining the ignition wires. Satisfied, he takes a  deep breath and starts the motor and then the first DST m nods inside the apartment building and another DST man co out with Agnieska next to him. He opens the door for her  when two shots ring out, both of them hitting her in the  forehead. The DST agents scatter for cover when suddenly car parked in front of the Renault explodes with tremendo force and the DST agents are all hit.

The Head KGB Officer is there. The Head KGB Officer has a file opened on his desk. In it are photographs of Ramirez jumping out of the apartment in Libya. None of the photog show his face clearly so there's no way of telling who it is. Just then the Aide comes in and hands a telex to the  Head KGB Officer.
(reading it) [When?]
[This afternoon... the girl and two  DST agents dead, one wounded.]
[So now we know... it was Carlos.]
He holds up the picture of Ramirez with just the back of head showing.
[We still have to tie him to the  CIA... if that is what's going on. I  won't make a move against him until  I know for sure.]
[Why?]

[Because my dear boy... four of his  colleagues shot in Libya, plus the  DST and now the girl. He's a very  dangerous fellow. One doesn't make a  move against such a man until one is  sure. And then one must move very  quickly and kill him... before he  has a chance to kill you.]
Ramirez crosses out of the arrival gate. He looks for all the world like a business traveler who is completely alon

The Cafeteria is crowded and noisy. Ramirez walks with hi tray as if looking for a table. There is an open seat whe Jack and Amos sit with their backs to each other at separ tables. Ramirez crosses to Jack. Ramirez is still bald bu his hair has grown out a bit.
(loudly) Is this seat taken?
No, go right ahead.
Ramirez sits down and now the conversation is in hushed t
I want to go home. I want to see my  family.
This isn't the place for this  conversation.

(pissed off) No rules, remember? I want to go  home. You said yourself we can't  move again till he leaves Libya. You  don't even know when that's gonna  be. He might stay there another year  for Christ's sake.
No he won't. He's gonna make a move  and it'll be in Europe just to stick  it up the DST's nose. I'm gonna go  and find out about our connecting  flight.
He picks up his soup spoon and turns it over and uses it scan what's going on around him.
IN the spoon we SEE Koj with a flight bag walking across cafeteria toward Ramirez.
Koj crosses around in front of Ramirez to get a better lo obviously surprised to see what he thinks is Carlos. Koj  leans in close to Ramirez.
(whispering) Carlos... what are you doing here?
Ramirez looks at him, shocked for a moment and then  recovering.
(hissing) You idiot! Don't you know better  than to approach me in public!
(loudly) Excuse me sir... I only wanted to  know where I could buy a newspaper.
Go over there by the phone booths  and wait... I'll come to you.
Ramirez gets up casually.
He has heard everything that has gone down.
He waits, standing a few feet away and not by the phones he was told. He watches Ramirez. Something doesn't jibe.. passwords were not exchanged. He crosses to Ramirez's sid
(loudly) Excuse me sir... I asked if you knew  where I could buy a newspaper.

Ramirez stops for a moment. He knows that the line is som kind of code and he has no response to give so he starts walking again. Koj is instantly behind Ramirez, his hand  going into his flight bag and pushing the flight bag up  against Ramirez's back.
Make the slightest move and I shoot...  and I don't miss. Walk to the rest  room, very carefully.
Ramirez does as he is told.

Amos. He watches it all going down in the back of a chrom napkin holder. He slowly gets up, looks around for Jack a goes out into the corridor and sees Koj and Ramirez going into the rest room. Koj sees one of those sandwich board  signs off to the side which says, "LAVATORY TEMPORARILY C FOR CLEANING." He pulls it in front of the door.

Koj has Ramirez's head with one hand, while he holds the on him with the other. He forces Ramirez's head down deep into the toilet bowl. He flushes. The water level sinks a then rises, covering Ramirez's face. Koj holds him under  water long enough to almost drown him. Then, instead of  lifting his head out, he flushes again and the water leve lowers.
Tell me what I want to know quickly  or you're dead.

Just then Ramirez manages to kick back and overpower Koj send him flying back out through the door of the stall.  Ramirez is back on him in a second but Koj has his gun up and pointed right at Ramirez's head. They have shifted  position now, so that they are not facing the stall, but door of the bathroom. Koj is about to pull the trigger wh we HEAR:
Down!!

Ramirez ducks and rolls out of the way and Amos fires two shots into Koj's chest but not before Koj can get off a r right into Amos' chest. In an instant Ramirez is on the s alive Koj grabbing his head in his hands and slamming it  down onto the edge of the sink with a thud that cracks hi skull. He quickly crosses to Amos who is dying.
Get out of here... now...
I've got to get you to a doctor.
Get out now...
Ramirez cradles him.
I'm not going to let you die here...  I've still got a lawsuit against  you, remember?
Here, Amos speaks as a doomed father would to a son who s has a chance to save himself from the Holocaust.
My dear boy... my dear dear boy... I  am dead. Please God, don't let it  all be for nothing... Get out now...
Ramirez stands as Amos literally pushes him away. Ramirez the brave and dutiful son as his father says, coaching,  teaching him to the last...
Walk slowly... no attention.
Ramirez is ashen faced, knows Amos is right and forces hi to stand up and walk almost robot-like out of the restroo

On a long shot we SEE Ramirez walk down the corridor till sees Jack. He says a few words to him and then starts to  walk back toward the restroom. Jack grabs his arm and  literally walks him out of the corridor and down an escal
Jack and Ramirez stand next to a phone booth. Jack is on phone dialing. A voice with a cool British accent answers the other end.
Cousins Industrial Maintenance, may  I help you?
Mister Simon Wicks, please.
Ringing.
Simon Wicks here.
This is Jack Shaw. Could you send a  clean-up crew to Heathrow. We've had  a rather nasty spill.
Ramirez is with Jack who is on the phone.
(into phone) Yes... I'm calling about my cousin...  Oh Jesus... Oh Jesus...
He shakes his head. Ramirez knows it means Amos is dead.
Oh God... no...
(into phone) I understand... Yes... Good bye.
He hangs up the phone.
Amos?
He's dead.

Why?! Why didn't you let me go back  to him... If we'd have gotten him  help sooner instead of... instead of  "we had a rather nasty spill!" Is  that what it was Jack? Is that all  Amos was... a rather nasty spill,  mop it up, it'll be okay?! Huh?!
(dead panned) He would have been dead anyway and  he knew it. That's why he told you  to get out.
Ramirez knows he's right.
(after a beat) Looks like you're going to get to  see your family after all.
What?
You're going home... it's off... for  the time being at least.
Bullshit! I want him. I want that  son of a bitch Carlos! And I want  him dead!
Tough shit what you want, Annibal.  Koj had a ticket for Libya on him.  Chances are he wasn't looking for  you but...
He wasn't looking for me... He thought  I was Carlos!

That's what I think too but the  Director wants an operation review  board... The DST shoot out... the  girl winds up dead in Paris... now  this... I've got to go back for the  review and you've got to go home.
No way man... it was my fault... the  whole thing... I want him dead!
What do you mean it was your fault?
When he asked me about the paper...  if I coulda just bullshitted my way...

It was a password... you didn't know  it... anything you would have tried  would have backfired. I had a thing  like that... Awfully warm for this  time of year... the response was,  yes but not as sticky as two summers  ago... the guy says anything else...  he even hesitates, you shoot him. I  shot him... There was nothing else  you could have done.
I'm not leavin' till we get him.
Nobody's askin' you. They're shuttin'  us down. You go back home... maybe  I'll see you again... maybe I won't.  You'll either hear from me or you'll  get new sea duty and that's the end  of it.
Ramirez just looks at him shocked.
Just like that?
Just like that. I ain't the Madam  kid... I'm just one of the whores.  And so are you.

A taxi pulls up in front of Ramirez's house. Ramirez step out of the taxi dressed in his Navy uniform and carrying sea bag. He does not have a hat on and we SEE his head wh not bald, is now in the shortest of buzz cuts, certainly  much shorter than the way his wife last saw him. He stand outside the house looking at it like an adult who has com back to his boyhood home and finds it suddenly so small.  Just then the door opens. There is Maura holding the baby and next to her, Joey. Ramirez runs toward them and they him and we SEE them in tableaux, embracing. An idyllic fa reunited.

We begin on a shot of Ramirez's chair. It rocks back and  forth violently as we PAN UP and SEE Ramirez, who is fuck Maura. They are both fully clothed, skirt hiked up, fly  unzipped. This is not lovemaking. He is fucking her brain out. It is passionate, rough sex. Maura hits high "C" as  Ramirez sweeps books off of a table, lifts her out of the chair and lays her out on the table. The two of them clim together. It is clear from Maura's look that this is the  best sex she's ever had. Ramirez slowly rolls off her. He smiling as well, and then becomes aware that Maura has be to cry.
What's wrong?
You've been with another woman...  haven't you.
What are you talking about?
Haven't you?
No. What... what would make you say  a thing like that?
You're different...

Maura... I was on a submarine...  there aren't any women on  submarines... There was nothin' to  do but read. They had one of those...  how to improve your sex life books...  I must have read it about ten times.  I tried out a couple of things from  chapter three okay? I mean if it  didn't turn you on blame Doctor Ruth  okay?
(unconvinced) Okay.
Great. You want to check with the  Navy to see if we had shore leave...  I'll get you a fuckin' letter okay?
I don't need any letters. And I don't  need you to talk to me like that  either.
Ramirez gets up and zips up his fly.
Where are you going?
Get somethin' to eat... I'm starving.
He exits.
Ramirez comes into the house from the garage.
Maura... Maura!
Maura comes out of the kitchen.
What?
Where's the car? The car's not in  the garage. Where's the car?
The fellow at the service station  said it needed a tune up. I took it  in this morning... You didn't say  you were going to need it.
Don't do that anymore.
What?
I don't want anybody workin' on the  car. Car needs something I'll do it.  But I don't want anybody touchin'  that car.
Why? What difference does it make.
It makes a difference to me okay? So  don't do it.
Did you check the mail?
Yeah I checked the mail. Still nothin'  from the Navy. Why, you so anxious  to get rid of me?
I don't want you goin' back to those  subs. I'll tell you that.
Yeah well I don't have much to say  about it. It's the Navy you know.
You can request another assignment.  It's changed you Annibal. It's hurting  us.
What's hurting us?
Your attitude... that's what hurting  us.
My attitude. I don't have an attitude  man... you got an attitude.
You're suspicious of everything that  goes on... you snap at Joey, you  snap at me. I don't like it.
Look I just... it's hard gettin'  used to... you know... it's hard...  Listen... tomorrow's Joey's game.  Let's just go to Joey's game. It'll  be nice. It'll be like it always  was. You'll see.
He holds her to him.

It is Little League Day. Adorable kids are dressed up in  their uniforms ready to play the next level of baseball.  They have graduated from T-ball to coach-pitch, in which coach pitches the ball for the kids. There are hot dogs a lounge chairs, family dogs and... fathers. The mothers ar there as well, as are brothers and sisters, but primarily is the fathers trying to fulfill their own dreams of spor glory through their kids.
Ramirez has his arm around Joey, giving him his last bit fatherly advice.
Okay... remember, what do we do?
Keep my eye on the ball.
And who's the guy who wins?
Whoever has fun, wins.
Right! So you go out there and have  fun.

He gives Joey "five" and Joey runs out to join his team a their dugout. Ramirez starts walking about toward Maura a the baby. As he does, he crosses next to another father,  FRANK, who is with his son TYLER. Frank is about six foot four and to say that he is competitive would be the  understatement of the year. He is haranguing his kid as i this were the deciding game of the World Series. He is on one knee so we don't see just how big he is.
I don't want so see you out there  dickin' around today, you understand?
Tyler looks at his shoes. He is cowed and embarrassed.
Yes sir.
You're gonna be focused and aggressive  and you're gonna play to win. Got  it?
Tyler is still staring at his toes.
Hey, you think I'm talking just to  hear myself talk? Look at me when  I'm talking to you!
Frank suddenly smacks him in the face. Annibal stops in f of the two of them.
Hey pal, lighten up, what do you  say? It's just a game?
Frank looks at Ramirez and stands to his full six foot fo
What did you say?
I said lighten up. It's just a game  and he's just a kid.
He's my kid.
Great. So why don't we let our kids  have a good time. Come on, I'll buy  you a beer.
I don't need you to buy me a fuckin'  beer, you piece of shit. And you  stick your face in my business again  and I'll beat the living fuck out of  you. What do you say to that?
There isn't a trace of Ramirez here at all. It is pure Ca
What are you smilin' at, asshole?
(very quiet) A dead man...
But before Ramirez can move, we HEAR:
Annibal... please!
Ramirez turns. Maura is there beside him.
Annibal please. Let's go sit down.
Good idea, Annabelle. Your ol' lady  just saved your ass.
Annibal... please... Please...
Maura tugs at Ramirez's arm and Frank smirks. Ramirez cag the monster inside and turns with Maura. As he turns, Fra turns to Tyler as if he cannot believe the boy is still t
What are you doin' standing here?!  You're supposed to be over there  with your team! Now move!
The boy hesitates. Frank rears back his arm to hit him.
I said...

But before Frank can complete the sentence and strike his child, Ramirez comes flying through the air with a kick  planted straight to Frank's head. It is sudden and violen and brutal. He comes down and with one side-kick, "knee-c Frank, which is to say he hits the top of Frank's kneecap and breaks it so that it is down around his shin. Frank s to drop but before he can, Ramirez grabs his ears and bri his head down into his own swiftly rising knee. The resul is devastating and Frank's nose is now all across his fac Blood is everywhere and Ramirez does it again. Now the ob is Frank's teeth, so that when his head comes off of Rami knee, his mouth is a mass of blood as well. In slow motion, Ramirez turns and sees his son who stares horror at what his father has just done. At the same time maura is up and grabbing onto Ramirez. Ramirez however is not done. Frank is completely defenseless now and Ramirez leans him back across his knee, pulls him by the hair exp his throat like that of a sacrificial lamb about to be  slaughtered. This time instead of a knife, it will be a k chop from Ramirez which will crush Frank's windpipe and k him. But before he can deliver the blow, Maura grabs his  arm. He turns to her, almost about to hit her or throw he off and the two of them are face to face as Ramirez looks from her to his son and realizes how deep into the abyss has plunged.
An ambulance is receiving what is left of Frank on a gurn as Ramirez is led away in handcuffs to a squad car.
The cell's metal door SCRAPES as it opens. The POLICE CAP motions to Ramirez to follow him.
Leading Ramirez through a number of corridors, the Captai stops at a closed door.
(opening the door) He's all yours.
Remaining outside he motions Ramirez to enter.
Ramirez enters and sees Jack who smiles his cynical smile
Little League, huh? Tough game.
What are you doing here?
It's show time.
Ramirez exits with Jack and starts across the street in t rain.
I got to have time to think it over.
There isn't any time. He's on his  way to East Berlin. We have word  he's planning another attack in  Europe. He'll be there maybe four  days at the most.
Ramirez stops dead right in the middle of the street. The traffic swirls around them.
Hey, I don't know what to do anymore,  okay? I almost killed some little  kid's father today. I don't know  about anything anymore.
Hey, he was a baseball dad. He  deserved it. Besides, from what I  heard his kid was out, so what's the  beef?
I don't know if I could come back  from it again.
What happened to I want the son of a  bitch dead? You think Carlos has had  a change of heart and turned nice  all of a sudden?

Don't tell me about Carlos, Jack. I  know exactly who Carlos is. I know a  hell of a lot better than you do.  But, maybe there's more important  things to me, like keepin' from goin'  crazy... like gettin' back to bein'  me instead of me bein' some kind of  fuckin' maniac.

You want to get back to bein' you?  Then finish it. Kill him. Kill him  and he's dead and it's over with.  You walk away from it now and what  do you think you're gonna be like  the next time you read that that son  of a bitch blew up some airplane  full of women and kids.
Hey, the guy deserves to be dead. I  know that.

This isn't abstract, Annibal. You're  walkin' around with his face. Sooner  or later one of the bad guys is gonna  see it like Koj did, and next time  Amos won't be there to take the bullet  for you. Carlos doesn't forget. You  help me get him or you're never gonna  know when he's comin' after you...  Listen to me kid. I don't have any  friends, no family, no nothin'. The  only relationships I ever had that  mattered to me were with the people  I killed. But I... I fucking created  you! You can't just walk away now.
You did create me, didn't you...  From the beginning... that kid in  the hospital in Bethesda... when I  was supposed to be the doctor... It  was all bullshit, wasn't it? All an  act...
There is a long pause. Jack turns cold as ice.

This doesn't have anything to do  with you and me. It's you and Carlos.  You help me kill him... or I swear  to you... I'll make sure he knows  about you... I'll use you for bait.  You and your whole fuckin' family  too.

Ramirez grabs him and throws him against a parked car. He begins choking Jack. He may well kill him. Though Ramirez doesn't see it at first, Jack's gun is already out. Jack  nudges Ramirez in the stomach with it. Jack is choking, u to speak, but the gun is speaking for him.
Huh? Huh?
Ramirez looks down and see the gun and loosens his grip.

You want to try and kill me, that  doesn't solve your problem, pally.  You've got a Carlos problem. That's  the guy you've got to kill. That's  what it's all about now... you...  and your family... or him.
Ramirez is there alone with Maura. They are in mid-argume
No! I won't let you do it! You're  not going back to those subs! It's  changed you... You need help, Annibal.  You could get some kind of stress  disability or...
Suddenly, Ramirez bellows and slams his hand down on the  counter.
Enough!
Maura is shocked by the sudden violence in him.
No, not enough. Whatever is going on  out there with your job...

With my job!? What do you think my  job is, Maura... huh? What do you  think is out there? A nice, pretty  safe little world with shopping malls  and little league and ballet lessons.  You sit here in your little kitchen  and cook your little meals...

He looks at her almost in disgust. She sees the look and  slaps him. Faster than she could ever have considered, he slaps her and sends her back into the wall. She holds her cheek. He is an inch away from her face and now he is abo to show her Carlos, to become him in front of her.
People are killing people out there!  Jackals are licking up their blood  waiting for the next corpse to drop...  and I'm one of them. You get that?  Do you get that now?!
He speaks very quietly, pulling the curtain aside, taking off the mask and letting her see the full horror.

I've murdered people. Not safe and  clean and surgical firing a missile  from some ship, but close and with  my hands so their blood splattered  on me... so their brains splattered  on me. And they weren't the enemy,  Maura... they were Allies. They were  on our side. It was just to keep a  cover... I've betrayed everything I  ever believed in. I've betrayed you...  I've fucked other women... I've killed  men... There was a woman I would  have killed but I just ran out of  time. I've let friends die... I've  become a terrorist... and I've made  you and the children a target. Do  you understand what I'm saying to  you? Do you see me now? Do you see  the monster? There's another one  worse than me and he is out there  and he will kill you and the children  if I don't kill him first... . That's  my job, Maura. And if you don't mind,  I'm late for work.

We are ON the ramparts on the top of the Berlin Wall. The are platforms from which people can stand and look into E Berlin, they're covered with graffiti to the East Germans LET MY PEOPLE GO, that sort of thing. They look down over they dingy wall that divides the city marked with machine gun nests and observation posts. Jack stands there with  Ramirez.

We used a double agent to get word  to the Russians that Carlos is really  here to close his deal with us and  not to plan a new attack in Europe.  He has a new girlfriend... He's been  fucking her brains out since he got  here. He has her brought over every  night in a limo. You'll be dropped  near the mansion... as soon as she  goes in, you make as if you're  sneaking out... the Russians will be  watching. You'll go to the meet.  It's at that beer hall, there...  see? You see it?
Ramirez locates the beer hall through his binoculars.
Got it.

You go to the meet at the beer hall.  Play it out... let 'em take your  picture... then you've got to get  back. They're going to have to analyze  the pictures and see through your  disguise before they can authorize a  hit. They won't be able to do that  before you're able to get back to  the mansion. At twenty-one fifteen a  Volga with diplomatic plates, DC- four-five-nine-two will come by the  northeast corner of the compound. It  will slow down... you jump in. If  you can't make it for any reason,  there will be another run at exactly  twenty-one forty-five. It's your  only ticket out so don't be late.
Who do I meet? Who's my contact?
Me... My ass is on the line too.
Who cares? This isn't you and me.  It's me and him. If the Russians  don't go for the bait for any  reason...
If the Russians don't go for the  bait for any reason you will have  gotten out of there at twenty-one  fifteen per orders.
If the Russians don't go for the  bait for any reason, I'll go in there  and kill him myself. And if I'm still  alive I might just come looking for  you.

Across a street with a tree-lined divider, a large mansio surrounded by a ten-foot high brick wall. The mansion's f windows are heavily shuttered, with little light filterin through. Nearby is a small lake.
Ivan looks through binoculars, staking out the mansion. H suddenly becomes agitated.
[Look!]
Andrei picks up his camera.
A man's figure emerges stealthily from the shadows of the mansion's back wall.
The blonde, bearded Ramirez.
[You think it's him?]
CLICK, CLICK, CLICK... The quick sound of the camera shut Faintly we HEAR the sound of a motorbike start up. Then w SEE Ramirez on the motorbike heading off. Ivan and Andrei follow him at a distance.
The KGB car falls in behind another car separating it fro the motorbike and follows Ramirez into town. He passes by giant steam pipes in the foreground as the KGB car follow

A tram wipes the screen to reveal Ramirez, on his motorbi followed by the KGB car. The landscape is desolate, with  drab row-houses. Ramirez gets to a red light. As it turns green he sees the KGB car in his mirror. He jams across t street, just barely fitting in between two criss-crossing streetcars. Ivan and Andre lose sight of Ramirez.
Ivan and Andre shoot forward and then slow, as they spot  Ramirez buying a newspaper at a newstand.
He holds his motorcycle helmet in his hand, and using it a mirror, he sees the KGB car in its reflection. Satisfie that they have caught up with him again, he walks across street to the beer hall.

The large bierstube is crowded, noisy and enveloped in a  thick cloud of cigarette smoke. Its lively, at times rowd clientele is in various stages of intoxication. As the lo oom-pah-pah-pah band plays popular German music, those wh are not too busy eating, talking, or emptying liter-sized beer steins, sing along.
Fighting the crowd, he heads for the back of the beer hal looking for his contact.
Entering the place, they pretend to be camera-carrying Ru tourists. A common sight in East Berlin.
He stops and stares.
Through the jam pack, the profile of a man, with a Tyrol who sits along the back wall. Busy eating, he seems total oblivious to the hoopla around him. We can't really see h face.

As he cautiously approaches what he thinks is Jack. It is him. There is a sudden look of panic on his face and then spots Jack also in the same kind of hat. Lifting his head and turning to face Ramirez, we too recognize him. Under hat, and the new heavy eyebrows and mustache, is... Jack. smiles, takes off his hat, and motions his quest to sit d
He's posing with a giant stein. A slight shift of focus a we can see Ramirez. Jack, however, is hidden by the waite back. Then, the Waiter moves on.
A clear, unobstructed picture of Jack and Ramirez up clos CLICK, CLICK, CLICK, CLICK, CLICK... The rapid CLICKING s only when the view of the two is blocked again by other  people.
Ramirez emerges from the beer hall. He heads back to his  motorbike.
Seconds later, the two KGB come out. This time, only Andr takes after Ramirez. Ivan gets into a taxi which heads in opposite direction.
Reaching the mansion, Ramirez discreetly steals his way t its back wall. Then, just as slyly as he earlier had  materialized, he disappears.
Watching Ramirez vanish into the mansion wall.

He lies in the thick bushes, completely obscured from any view and now he removes the blond wig and the rest of his disguise. Underneath his "disguise" clothes, he is wearin pair of black jeans and black T-shirt. He looks exactly l Carlos now.

head_text.subj: ON HERE. THE REAL CARLOS HAS NOT DYED HIS HAIR BLOND. THI
WAS NOT THE REASON FOR RAMIREZ PUTTING ON A BLOND WIG. TH
LOGIC HERE IS THAT IF THE "REAL CARLOS" WERE IN FACT GOIN
TO A MEET WITH A CIA AGENT, HE WOULD HAVE PUT ON SUCH A
DISGUISE TO MAKE SURE HE WAS NOT SPOTTED BY THE RUSSIANS.

text: Jack takes off his disguise as he drives the Volga to the appointed corner of Carlos' compound. He looks at his wat reads: 9:15 as he slows the car to a crawl.
(to himself) Come on... come on...
Ramirez watches as Jack cruises by.
Not till he's dead, Jack. Not till  he's dead.
Jack sees that Ramirez is not going to show.
Shit.

A head shot of Ramirez in his latest blond, bearded disgu Grainy and blurred at first, it's gradually being brought into sharp focus. PULL BACK to reveal a GROUP OF MEN closely watching the s of an impressive, state-of-the-art computer. We recognize only one of them. Andrei. At the computer's sophisticated keyboard -- manipulating the images on the screen -- are TECHNICIANS in white overalls. Right behind them stands t Head KGB Officer from Moscow and his Aide.
(orders the technicians) [Now Carlos.]
It bisects, to allow a picture of the real Jackal (the  splitting image of Ramirez) to appear on the right half o the screen.
The Head KGB Officer puts on his glasses and takes a clos look at the monitor.
[The beard and moustache.]
One of the two technicians toys with the keyboard.
The beard and moustache on Ramirez' disguised image slowl disappear. The two faces look very similar.
A huge nose covers the entire left half of the screen.
The upper part of the nose only. And... the incriminating hairline where the bogus schnoz had been superimposed on real one.
[The nose is a fake.]
[Match the nose. And get rid of this  wig...]
As the aquiline nose assumes the shape of the Jackal's -- the hair changes both color and form to match his -- the faces on the screen become identical.
[Have you identified the one he was  meeting with?]
[His name is Jack Shaw. CIA  Counterterrorism.]
The Head KGB Officer turns to his Aide.
[Get me the MFS on the secure phone.  I want them out of the way.]

It opens slowly. One by one, a half dozen MFS -- includin the two we've seen earlier -- sneak out. Just as furtivel armed KGB -- led by the Head KGB Officer and his Aide mov in through the still-open door.
He watches the KGB men enter the compound.
(sotto voce) Don't blow it Comrades... kill him.

Meeting no resistance on the ground floor -- whose securi apparently has been the task of the MFS -- the intruders  climb the open, spiral staircase. They move cautiously,  silencer-equipped weapons in hand.

Reaching the upper floor, they hear the muffled sound of  RHYTHMIC MUSIC coming from the far end of the hallway to  their right. The Head KGB Officer motions his Aide to mov into the corridor to their left. He does, taking three KG with him. Four others -- including Andrei and Ivan -- fol the Head KGB Officer into the hallway to their right.
It's long, with several rooms on each side. As Vladimir m gingerly into the first one, Ivan covers him from the doo

Illuminated only by the light which filters through the o door, the room is quite dark. A faint sound of SNORING re Andrei from the bed closest to the door. Quickly there, h arm goes up. Then, for a split second, the flash of metal the knife comes down hard. The victim's last MURMUR. Foll by the SOUND OF MOVEMENT at the other bed.
In the beam of Ivan's flashlight, a waking JAPANESE is  reaching for his gun. Pffft. Pfffft. And he too falls bac to sleep. Eternally.
TWO more JAPANESE in the midst of a Go game meet the same fate. A burst from Head KGB Officer's automatic finishes  them off.
Doing away with several more of Carlos' multinational gan the five KGB finally reach the room with the large, heavy French doors at the end of hallway.
Quietly approaching the carved-wood doors, a KGB tries th knobs. The doors are locked. Suddenly, the pulsating LATI BEAT which emanated continuously from behind the doors, s
He's startled by the sudden silence.
(whispering) [Quick! Quick!]
Not wasting any time, Andrei and Ivan kick the doors open Diving to the side, they cover the other two KGB who stor in with their Kalashnikovs very much at the ready.

The voluptuous blonde -- her body glazed with post-coitus sweat -- is paralyzed with fear; covering her prized asse seems the last thing on her mind. She gapes at the KGB  marauders with wide, blue eyes. Not so, Ramirez's look-al Caught reaching from under the sheets to replace the tape the stereo by the bed, he instinctively tries for his gun
Standing at the door. His automatic no longer has a silen
(sarcastic) Don't even think about it. It would  deprive the KGB of the pleasure of  interrogating you.
Surprisingly, he seems quite relieved.
KGB? I thought...
What? That we were your new friends...  The CIA... Jack Shaw...
Jack Shaw...?
Stop playing games. And it's no use  looking behind me... Your associates  can no longer be of assistance. Not  to you, not to anyone...
(angry) Comrade, you'd getter have an  explanation --
You've got it all wrong, Illich.  It's you who has all the explaining  to do... Now get dressed! (to the blonde) You too, Fraulein.
My pants...

The Head KGB Officer motions to Andrei, who throws Carlos his pants -- but not before checking to make sure there's weapon in them. He then hands the blonde -- who finally h her bazooms behind a sheet -- her clothes.
(continuing; getting  dressed) That's what was going on in Libya.  The CIA... The DST... They're trying  to set me up and you're falling for  it, you idiot!
Enough. We tailed you to your meeting.  We have the pictures of you with  Shaw.
That's impossible. I've been here  all night. (points to the blonde) Ask her. (to the blonde) Tell him.
She's putting stockings on a pair of legs that could dist even the most committed KGB.
(in a voice matching  her looks) It's true. All night...
(unimpressed) We know about your women... Now hurry  up, both of you!
With Kalashnikovs still trained on Carlos, they seem unab to resist stealing glances at the blonde.
(to Head KGB Officer) I'll prove it to you. You'll be  pleading for my forgiveness. Let's  just go. I want to be interrogated.  I demand to be interrogated.
He seems truly eager to leave with them now, as if confid he can prove his case. Dressed, with the exception of a  jacket, he casually grabs one which lies on a nearby chai
WAIT!
Too late. The Scorpion machine-pistol is already out, spo deadly accurate fire. He kills the Head KGB Officer first then...
They drop like flies, their bullets hitting everything bu him.
Hysterical, she screams her healthy lungs out.
Suddenly there's the sound of APPROACHING STEPS. The KGB down the corridor, rushing to the bedroom, led by the Aid
He doesn't hesitate. Firing a few rounds at them, he spri toward the window and literally flies through its shatter glass.
Ramirez lies in some bushes about fifty yards from the ho dressed in the black jeans and T-shirt. He hears the gunf from the mansion.
What the fuck?
It's a dark night, and only a few dim lights illuminate t rather large back yard.
Landing in a bed of flowers, he rolls, and is quickly on feet with the machine-pistol in hand.
Securing the courtyard, they rush to the spot where,  apparently, they'd seen him land. Carlos, however, is no  longer there.

Glued to the back of a tree, the Jackal cuts them down wi one short burst and goes for the KGBs who appear at the b window. As they take cover, he quickly confiscates a  Kalashnikov from the dead KGB closest to him and makes it the high wall which encircles the place. Carlos climbs over the wall with the Kalashnikov and drop outside the compound to the grass below.

He sees to his horror that Carlos is getting away. He is  ready to scream, going crazy. He has no gun, he wouldn't  stand a chance against Carlos, but there is no way he is  going to let him get away, no way. He looks around for a  rock... anything. There is nothing. Carlos turns his back. Ramirez sees his chance, he gets up on one knee ready to make his move whe suddenly he sees two more KGB guys come running around th wall of the compound.
He mouths the words:
Kill him... Kill him...
He whirls and fires at the two KGBs who fall.
He can't believe it. Carlos is getting away?

He suddenly gets a look as if he feels someone's presence His eyes open wide and he starts to turn when Ramirez com flying out of the darkness and leaps on Carlos. The two a dressed exactly alike. Carlos is hit from behind and is  stunned and drops the assault rifle. Ramirez has Carlos down and is choking him. Carlos looks at him more shocked than anything else. Finally Carlos ma to break the grasp and kicks Ramirez off. Now it is a daz display of martial arts. Then Ramirez charges Carlos and  tackles him and the two go rolling off into the bushes an darkness. When they roll out of the bushes we have no ide which one is which or who we should be rooting for. Just  then Jack's Volga drives up at the side.

They roll over onto the bodies of two dead KGB. There is Kalashnikov on the ground pointed into the Carlos on the  bottom's side. The Carlos who is on top manages to get hi finger over to the trigger and pulls it sending a burst i the Carlos on the bottom's body. Just then the Carlos on looks up and sees Jack standing over him with a gun point at him ready to shoot. In b.g. we HEAR cars with sirens  approaching. The Carlos on top looks over to Jack who is  ready to shoot him.
Don't shoot. It's me you asshole!
Jack just stares at him and then lowers his gun.
Let's get the fuck out of here.
He turns around and starts to get into the Volga. The Car on top, whom we just thought was Ramirez bends down and  reaches for the dead KGB's pistol.

He gets that sixth sense feeling and turns around, his gu raised and pointed at the man whose hand is now on the pi Is it Carlos or Ramirez, who is standing there with pisto in hand almost turned to Jack but still at a disadvantage this Mexican stand off.
Have you come looking for me now,  Annibal?
What the fuck are you talking about...
Awfully warm for this time of year  isn't it?

The man with the pistol knows this is a password of some  kind and the look on his face betrays the fact that he do have an answer. Jack is just about to shoot him when a bu of machine gun fire is heard from the approaching cars an it rips into the tree next to Jack who dives for cover. That act of self-preservation gives the man we now realiz is the real Carlos the chance he needs. With catlike grac he dives, rolls and vanishes into the shadows. He has got away and Jack has to decide whether to go after his quarr or rescue his friend. He opts for the latter, scoops up  Annibal and throws him into the Volga and speeds off as c approach from the other side.
Ramirez is in bed, hooked up to all the monitors and tube and IVs but he is going to make it. Jack is there with hi having just entered.
Any word?
How you feeling?
Did he get away?
Jack nods his head. Ramirez almost breaks down in tears.  Jack crosses to him to comfort him.
Then it was all for nothing... the  whole thing.

No it wasn't. He's finished. The KGB  bought it. As far as they're  concerned, he's the enemy now. He'll  bounce around from one country to  the next. But his paymasters have  disowned him. None of their client  states will risk using him. No one'll  trust him again. He'll spend the  rest of his life looking over his  shoulder waiting to be betrayed. And  it'll happen... sooner or later...  when it's to some country's  advantage... they'll give him up or  they'll trade him. He's finished. It  worked and he's finished.
Not for me he isn't... There are  still two of us...
A car pulls up at the hospital and Maura gets out and ent the hospital.
Maura is there with Ramirez. He is in mid-conversation wi her. We don't know how long she's been there. He opens hi eyes.
Is it over?
No.
She crosses to him and gently takes his hand in hers.
You have to make a new life for  yourself and the children.
No.

Maura, anytime I start a car I'll  wonder if this is the one that  explodes. I couldn't bear the thought  of you and the children being in  that danger. He'll want me and  everyone I've ever loved to be dead.  Trust me... I know how he thinks  because it's the way I think now  too. I am so... sorry. I am so  sorry...
Maura looks at him imploring him with her eyes.
I won't leave you.
Maura, when my father was put into  prison he told my mother to take me  and leave and start a new life. That's  what you've got to do.
You're not in prison and I'm not  your mother and I won't leave you. I  will not let him do this to us. Not  him... not the CIA... not anyone.
He'll come after me.
Get me a gun and teach me to shoot  and he'll have to deal with both of  us. This animal will not destroy my  family. Please... come home.
We hear a phone ring and it is picked up.
Hello...
We hear the voice of a friend of hers named GRACE.
Hi... listen, do you and Annibal  want to come over with the kids for  a barbeque this afternoon?
Uh sure, I think... but could I call  you back later? We're just about to  go to church. Annibal and the kids  are already in the car.
Okay, call me when you get back.
Great. Talk to you later. Bye bye.

We hear the phone hang up. We hear the sound of a door op and closing that leads into the garage from the house. We hear the sound of a car door opening. And then the key tu in an ignition. And then the door is blown off the garage we see the Ramirez family car burst into an inferno and b away inside the garage in a fiery blast which would kill and all instantly.

The cemetery is set up for a funeral. There are various N officers and their families in the chairs. At the back of all stands Jack wearing sunglasses, his face a mask into  which it is impossible to read any emotion of any kind. T are four graves and four coffins, two adult-sized and two small ones. Admiral Crawford addresses the mourners.

How does one even begin to comprehend  a tragedy like this. A highly  respected Naval officer returns from  six months of hazardous duty. He has  escaped the danger we all come to  know in the service of our country.  He is about to go to church with his  beloved family and in an instant...  they are no more. They are with God.  Our minds cannot comprehend such  tragedy... only an undying faith in  the Almighty a faith that says even  though we cannot see it, there is a  plan. That and the knowledge that as  in life, so for eternity are they  together...
He whispers to himself as he takes off his sunglasses.
Now you're free.

It is a beautiful island community with clusters of villa overlooking a magnificent coastline. A postal truck winds its way towards one of the houses. The POSTMAN gets out of his truck and crosses to the door the house. He knocks on the door. The door opens... it is Ramirez... or Carlos... we don't know which. He wears sho and a shirt.
Mister Mendoza?
Yes.
Special delivery letter for you sir.
The Postman hands the man an envelope. He signs for it an opens the envelope. It is a newspaper clipping...
The headline is: NAVAL OFFICER AND FAMILY KILLED IN FIERY CRASH. There is a handwritten note attached. It says, "Re in Peace."
Not bad news I hope.
Someone... died.
I'm so sorry.
This guy's better off dead.
No one is better off dead I think.
Some people are.
He tips the postman and closes the door.

Mendoza crosses into the house holding the newspaper clip He takes a cigarette lighter and burns it and across his  face there is a hint of a smile... a very cold smile. He  crosses out to the veranda. Down on the beach below, we S Maura and the baby and Joey playing.
Poppi... come down and play with us.
We now know the man is Ramirez. He walks down the steps o his house to the beach to his wife and his children as we

AGAIN. HE MOVED TO YEMEN, THEN JORDAN, THEN SYRIA AND FIN

text: The old man locks the door and stands in front of the mir He pulls off the burn makeup and scalp wig and we see tha he is Carlos. Several years older, but unmistakable. He t off the old man's clothes and stuffs them in a trash can underneath he wears the black jeans and T-shirt. Then he  straightens up and exits the rest room.

location: CORRIDOR BETWEEN RESTROOM AND DR.'S OFFICE

text: Carlos walks down the corridor and enters the medical sui of Doctor Wasfi Muhammed. There is a plaque on the door w says, DR. WASFI MUHAMMED, M.D., PhD, Cosmetic and Plastic Surgery.

This is a surgery suite complete with gas anesthetic, a k of high-tech barber chair that reclines for full surgery, gleaming scalpels, etc. DR. MOHAMMED is there with Carlos The Doctor is hastily washing his hands.
You're quite early. I wasn't expecting  you for another half an hour.
I like to be unannounced. It's safer  that way.

Yes, yes, of course. If you'll just  have a seat. I've done everything as  you said. My assistant has been let  go for the day. I'll administer the  anesthetic myself. I assure you sir,  you are completely safe here.
He turns around to look into the barrel of Carlos' drawn cocked .38 automatic.
I know.
The scene is as before. The two bodyguards stand watch.  Suddenly a car pulls up. Another bodyguard gets out and o of this car steps Carlos. The bodyguards acknowledge him he enters the building.
Carlos leans back in the surgery chair. There is an IV  attached to his arm. A Doctor in a surgical mask stands o him.
Feeling drowsy now?
Yes...
Would you like to see what your new  face is going to look like when we're  done?
Yes... of course.
It's going to look just like this...

He pulls down his surgical mask and Carlos looks up at hi own face. It is Ramirez. He holds Carlos, who struggles  against the anaesthetic. Suddenly, a second pair of hands grab Carlos as well. It is Jack.

An ambulance is pulled up at the rear entrance and two  attendants push a gurney out of the building with a patie whose face is covered by an oxygen mask. The two attendan push the gurney into the ambulance and race off.

head_text.subj: CARLOS WAS FINALLY ARRESTED IN THE SUDAN AND FLOWN TO FRA
TO STAND TRIAL IN AUGUST OF 1994.
